content: Yes, you can use smart home technology if you rent your home instead of owning it. There are numerous smart home devices available in the market that do not require any installation or structural modifications to the property. These devices can be easily installed and uninstalled without causing any permanent damage to the property. Moreover, most smart home devices are portable and can be taken with you when you move out. However, before investing in any smart home technologies, you should seek permission from your landlord or check your lease agreement to ensure that you are not violating any terms or conditions.
